result.execSummary:
The defendant Jermaine D Cohill was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Pay $500 fine PLUS all costs, fees and surcharges, including DNA surcharge, by 02-09-16.
Failre to pay will result in a civil judgment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jermaine D Cohill

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jermaine D Cohill in court with attorney Edward Wright for attorney Robert E Webb.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Defendant consistently test negative and attends appointments.  Verification of community service was needed.  

The defendant has complied with the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.
On motion of the state, the court amended the charge to Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 450.11(7)(h), a class U misdemeanor.   Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction to the amended charge.

Court orders defendant to pay a fine of $500.00 plus all cost, fees and surcharges, including DNA surcharge by 02/09/2016 or a civil judgment to be entered with tax intercept.  Bail on deposit to be applied if applicable.

Defendant Jermaine D Cohill in court with attorney Robert E Webb.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  Defendant is testing negative and attending treatment at Fokus Family.  Defendant has completed community service.  Review hearing scheduled for February 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jermaine D Cohill in court with attorney Robert E Webb.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
The parties have agreed to a deferred judgment agreement.
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, pled GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgment of Conviction.  The court approved the Deferred Prosecution Agreement and ordered the case transferred to Judge Brostrom, Branch 6 for a review hearing on 9-30-2014 at 8:30 am.  aw  Review hearing scheduled for September 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jermaine D Cohill in court with attorney Robert E Webb.  Patricia I Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel has no motions to be filed.  State has offered the defendant a DPA.  Case adjourned for DPA hearing on 8/6/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  aw  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for August 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Jermaine D Cohill in court with attorney Robert E Webb.  Patricia I Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  State has turned over all discovery to defense counsel.  Defendant to have a TAD assessment.  State will provide a offer before the next court date.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 5/27/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court ordered all motions be filed by the next court date.  aw  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jermaine D Cohill in court with attorney Robert E. Webb.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Arraignment scheduled for April 29, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with V.A. Medical Center; except to contest job status with attorney or union rep.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Jermaine D Cohill in court with attorney Robert E. Webb.  Karine E. O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 3-27-14 @ 1:30 P.M.
